meanings.definition: A group of three people who share power or authority.
meanings.sent2: The school board acted as a triumvirate to oversee the new policy implementation.
meanings.sent3: The three friends formed a triumvirate to plan the surprise party.
meanings.sent4: In the business world, the triumvirate of CEOs led the company to success.
meanings.sent5: The triumvirate of siblings always stuck together through thick and thin.

meanings.definition: A ruling body of three individuals.
meanings.sent1: The triumvirate issued a decree to address the crisis.
meanings.sent2: The ancient Roman triumvirate governed the empire with shared authority.
meanings.sent3: The triumvirate of cats decided to take over the sunny spot by the window.
meanings.sent4: The triumvirate of judges delivered a fair verdict in the courtroom.
meanings.sent5: The triumvirate of superheroes joined forces to defeat the villain.

meanings.definition: A coalition or alliance of three individuals.
meanings.sent1: The triumvirate of nations worked together to promote peace.
meanings.sent2: The political triumvirate negotiated a compromise to end the deadlock.
meanings.sent3: The triumvirate of chefs collaborated to create a new menu for the restaurant.
meanings.sent4: The triumvirate of friends planned a weekend getaway to the mountains.
meanings.sent5: The triumvirate of musicians performed a stunning concert together.
